qa_pairs.question: How long has Ariana Wilson been with the San Francisco Fire Department?
qa_pairs.answer: Ariana Wilson has been employed with the San Francisco Fire Department for the past 7 years and volunteered with them for about two and a half years prior.
qa_pairs.source_text: hello my name is Ariana Wilson I am a San Francisco firefighter with the San Francisco Fire Department Ive been employed with them for the past 7 years prior to that volunteered with them for about two and a half years

qa_pairs.question: Where did Ariana Wilson grow up?
qa_pairs.answer: Ariana Wilson was born on Trader Street, grew up most of her life on Ocean Avenue, and spent the latter part of her life in the Panhandle region.
qa_pairs.source_text: I was born on Trader Street and then grew up most of my life on Ocean Avenue and then spent the latter part of my life over in the panan region

qa_pairs.question: How did Ariana Wilson manage housing during her time at the fire academy?
qa_pairs.answer: Ariana Wilson stayed with her dad through the fire academy due to expenses around housing in the city.
qa_pairs.source_text: when I got hired with the fire department I ended up actually staying with my dad through the fire academy just due to expenses around housing in the city

qa_pairs.question: How did Ariana Wilson secure housing after graduating from the fire academy?
qa_pairs.answer: After graduating, Ariana Wilson was able to rent a unit in a building that her grandmother purchased a long time ago.
qa_pairs.source_text: luckily after I graduated we were lucky enough to have a building that my grandmother purchased a very long time ago and so I was able to rent a unit in that building for my family

qa_pairs.question: What is the general housing situation in San Francisco according to Ariana Wilson?
qa_pairs.answer: San Francisco is not a very affordable city. Most of Ariana's friends have two or three roommates, some live in co-ops with about 10 to 12 people, and some coworkers have had to leave the city to afford rent.
qa_pairs.source_text: so in general San Francisco is not a very affordable City most of my friends either have two or three roommates some people live in co-ops which means theyre living with about 10 to 12 people just to afford living here in the city um I have quite a few co-workers have had to actually leave the city to afford rent

qa_pairs.question: What challenges do families face in San Francisco regarding housing and education?
qa_pairs.answer: Families with two or three children find it unaffordable to pay for the type of schooling they want in the city in addition to rent.
qa_pairs.source_text: just due to access to schooling for their children um they have two or three children and its just not affordable to pay for the type of schooling that they want in the city in addition to rent

qa_pairs.question: How does Ariana Wilson describe the impact of housing costs on her family?
qa_pairs.answer: If it wasn't for the building her grandma owned at a somewhat prated rent, Ariana would not be able to afford her own place in the city on her income.
qa_pairs.source_text: so if it wasnt for the building that my grandma owned at somewhat of a prated rent I would not be able to probably afford my own place in the city on the income that I have

qa_pairs.question: What is the housing situation for Ariana Wilson's father?
qa_pairs.answer: Ariana's father, a retired union plumber, would not be able to afford living in San Francisco on his retirement and Social Security income.
qa_pairs.source_text: my father was a union plumber for the last last 30 years with the city and county of San Francisco he has since then retired and based on what he makes on retirement and Social Security it would not be attainable for him to live here in this city

qa_pairs.question: What is the living situation of Ariana Wilson's youngest sister?
qa_pairs.answer: Ariana's youngest sister is living at home with their mom due to the high cost of rent.
qa_pairs.source_text: so my youngest sister she got home from college a couple years ago and is still living at home with our mom due to the fact that rent is so expensive

qa_pairs.question: What was the residency requirement for the San Francisco Fire Department?
qa_pairs.answer: The San Francisco Fire Department used to have a residency requirement that you had to be a San Francisco resident to work there, which was in place due to susceptibility to natural disasters like earthquakes.
qa_pairs.source_text: yeah so the San Francisco Fire Department used to have a residency requirement which meant that you had to be a San Francisco resident to work here and in part that was in place due to the fact that we are susceptible to natural disasters specifically earthquakes

qa_pairs.question: What changes have occurred in the Panhandle region where Ariana Wilson grew up?
qa_pairs.answer: The Panhandle region has seen a shift with churches no longer active due to lack of funding and people moving away, leading to a change in community dynamics.
qa_pairs.source_text: but in the later part of our Lives we spent a lot of time near the Panhandle and growing up there were churches that were active which no longer are partially because of the lack of funding or people that previously lived there that actually used to um go to church they no longer live there

qa_pairs.question: What was the impact of housing policies on the African-American community in Ariana Wilson's neighborhood?
qa_pairs.answer: There was a mass exodus of the African-American community due to promises of affordable housing that were not fulfilled, leading to a shift in the community.
qa_pairs.source_text: the neighborhood I grew up in was predominantly African-American and probably when I was about 12 or 13 um there was this Mass Exodus and people were told that were staying in kind of affordable housing that if they left and came back Renovations would have a place for them and that really wasnt the case

qa_pairs.question: How does Ariana Wilson describe the change in community dynamics in her neighborhood?
qa_pairs.answer: Ariana describes a shift from a close-knit community where neighbors knew each other to a more isolated environment where knocking on a neighbor's door is met with suspicion.
qa_pairs.source_text: as a kid we had our local corner store and everybody knew us by first name basis we had grandparents that kind of looked out for us and houses that we could go in and out of and now the neighborhood that I live in you knock on a neighbors door and you try and say hello and its kind of welcom with a what are you doing

qa_pairs.question: What challenges does Ariana Wilson face in buying property in San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: Ariana finds properties in San Francisco far out of range financially, forcing her to consider looking in other communities outside of the Bay Area.
qa_pairs.source_text: but even currently trying to look at properties for myself to even think about buying theyre so far out of range that I have to and Im almost forced to start looking in other communities outside of the Bay Area

qa_pairs.question: What does Ariana Wilson consider a resource-rich neighborhood?
qa_pairs.answer: A resource-rich neighborhood would have access to a good library, places of prayer, a safe community center, good education, and public schools with good reviews.
qa_pairs.source_text: while resource neighborhood to me would mean having access to a good and running Library a place of prayer if that is something that is important to somebodys religious beliefs a safe Community Center good education a good public school with good reviews

qa_pairs.question: What disparities does Ariana Wilson observe between different neighborhoods in San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: Ariana observes stark differences in resources between well-populated, financially supported communities and those that aren't, such as Noe Valley versus Bayview Hunters Point.
qa_pairs.source_text: but there is a stark difference between the well populated well financially supported communities versus ones that arent right so if we look at lets say noi Valley versus Bay View Hunters Point bayew Hunters Point has all has been an environment where you do not have access to the resources that any other community in the city does

qa_pairs.question: What is Ariana Wilson's view on the development of resources in Bayview Hunters Point?
qa_pairs.answer: Ariana questions why it takes an influx of money for resources to be built in Bayview Hunters Point, a disparity known since her childhood.
qa_pairs.source_text: and as we see that and as we see an influx of money moving there we see more resources being built but something that iol question is why is it it take why does it take that in order for these resources to be built but this has been something that ever since I was a kid we knew existed

qa_pairs.question: What is the community response to building housing in specific neighborhoods?
qa_pairs.answer: There is often backlash against building housing in specific neighborhoods, such as the old Children's Hospital site, which has been vacant for years.
qa_pairs.source_text: yeah I know theres always a kickback and a pushback for building housing in specific neighborhoods for instance the old Childrens Hospital has been vacant now for I want to say a number of years and this would be a great place to create housing and theres been a lot of backlash from the neighborhood
